ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] The new version of Jonthan's Provocation
ygData.msgSnippet: One odd interaction is that Chant of Battle will over-write and block Provocation.  I heard that Provocation will stack with Warsong though.  Did not get a
ygData.messageBody:
One odd interaction is that Chant of Battle will over-write and block
Provocation. I heard that Provocation will stack with Warsong though. Did
not get a chance to check that.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)
> [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 16, 2000 12:49 PM
> To: EQBards
> Subject: [eqbards] The new version of Jonthan's Provocation
>
>
> Decided to give this song a whirl last night. Went to the
> yeti caves in
> Dreadlands and Lament pulled a single yeti (blue con) outside. Weaved
> Jonthan's, Chains and Fear. For the first time in a long time, I solo
> tanked a mob to death. The haste with Jonthan's is
> tremendous. I would
> estimate it is close to enchanter's SLW. The only time I
> ever got hit was
> when fear broke early. Most fights I would only lose one bub
> of health, two
> if I was really unlucky. Tried the same tactic with a
> stonegazer cockatrice
> with similar results.
>
> So the new version of Jonthan's Provocation looks like it
> will help us solo
> blue mobs tremendously. If it still included the rune
> shield, soloing would
> be even easier coz there would be less downtime for healing.
>
> One drawback that I did notice was it didn't stack with
> Berserker (and I
> assume our other combat enhancing songs) for other party
> members. Since
> Jonthan's Provocation is self only, other songs like
> Berserker should still
> affect everyone in the group beside the bard. This is not
> the case. I
> tested it by starting Jonthan's, then starting Berserker. I asked the
> others in my party if they were getting the message "You go
> berserk" as well
> as an icon on the screen. As long as I had Jonthan's in
> effect on myself,
> no one else in the party got the benefit of Berserker. This
> sounds like a
> bug to me.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
> 45 bard
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
